comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: @iSazonov I think PowerShell-Docs repo should contain only GA-related information. Ubuntu 18.04 is not supported for PowerShell Core 6.0.2.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @alexandair PowerShell-Docs has a branch for the 6.1.0 release where these vNext issues can be addressed. https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/tree/release-ps61

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
I would expect some type of documentation to be provided for the Preview releases instead of doing trial and error figured out yourself kind-of-thing.

If is not documented in the Microsoft Docs, then why not create another doc section on Github for updated Preview installation instructions?

:)

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: as per @markekraus point above this is already in place with v6.1 branch of the docs with the benefit that when 6.1 GA's then the docs are already there

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
IMO, preview releases are intended for a technical audience that should not require specific documentation on installation unless there is some major change to the installation process. That kind of information should be present in the release notes for the RC/Preview release. 

The 6.1.0-preview.3 release page provides links to deb packages and the installation of deb  packages is pretty straight forward. IMO, There should be a realistic expectation from technical users testing Preview and RC releases that live documentation will reflect the latest GA release, and not the RC and preview releases.

As the information relevant to this issue is [already present in the correct documentation branch](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/blob/release-ps61/reference/docs-conceptual/setup/Installing-PowerShell-Core-on-Linux.md#ubuntu-1804) in PowerShell-Docs I am closing this issue.
